newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Italy's Alpi Eagles starts flight to Romania.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Alpi Eagles starts flight to Romania.

text.p: Private Italian airline Alpi Eagles has begun flights from Verona to Romania's western city of Arad, an airport official said on Tuesday.
" Alpi Eagles will operate three flights a week on the route Verona-Arad and back on a Fokker 100 aircraft," Arad airport director Gheorghe Udrescu said.
The flights -- on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays -- were targeted at the large Italian business community in the Arad area. The aircraft is equipped to take 85 passengers, with 27 business class.

"There are some 800 Romanian-Italian joint ventures in Arad and 1,000 more in the neighbouring counties of Bihor and Timis, which is why we are also looking at opening cargo flights with the same partner," Udrescu said.
He said Arad -- some 20 kms away from the border with Hungary -- was also interesting for Hungarian businessmen from the nearby towns of Szeged and Bekescsaba. -- Bucharest newsroom 40-1 3120264
